content: beholder a dungeons and dragons creature notes this pattern is for personal use only concept and general design is that of wizards of the coast this pattern is my very first and hasn t been tested as yet please let me know if you come across any problems or would like to make any recommendations when adding the eye stalks i poked the pipe cleaner through the body i think it gives the stalks a little more stability feel free to make as many eye stalks as you d like and make them as long as you d like i originally only had 8 eye stalks but then my brother got into my head and made me think i had to get it as close to the actual thing as possible pattern is worked in continuous rounds unless otherwise specified check me out on ravelry or give me a follow on instagram pinterest or tumblr i d love to see your finished creation you can post or submit it one on of my social media sites or email it to knottycritters@gmail com materials 3 mm crochet hook size of finished product will vary if hook size is different just make sure you use a hook size that works with your yarn 2 mm crochet hook for the main eye fingering yarn multiple colours for the main eye worsted weight yarn whatever colour / colours appeal to you the yarn i used in the photo above was from my grandmother s old stash i just loved the colours yarn need scissors pipe cleaners safety eyes or whatever else you d like to use for eyes i used 11 safety eyes of various sizes and colours poly stuffing or your preferred stuffing felt for the teeth the pattern does not include instructions for teeth i just kind of made-it-work thin cardboard or plastic i used this to help keep the inside of the mouth flat sewing needle and thread to attach the cardboard / plastic to the mouth stitches to know
